result.execSummary:
The defendant Danah Marie Wiedemeier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 8/8/2022, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.
AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain a mental health evaluation, and follow through with any recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danah Marie Wiedemeier

defendant.name: Wiedemeier, Danah Marie
defendant.address: 4408 Hwy B, Land O' Lakes, WI 54540

records.addlTxt: 10:12 AM Defendant Danah Marie Wiedemeier in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Danah Marie Wiedemeier.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Count 1: Plea of guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Victim rights legislation has been complied with.  Court imposes 30 days in county jail, consecutive to 21CM313 - STAYED. 12 months probation ordered.  Conditions of probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent, Obtain a mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommendations, Seek full-time employment, Maintain absolute sobriety, Costs of $443.  1 day credit in the event of revocation.   Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 8/7/2022, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office. DNA submitted previously.

22-002294

Defendant Danah Marie Wiedemeier appeared by video  with Attorney Nagel. Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant received the complaint and Attorney Nagel waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Court sets $2500.00 signature bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, not to possess controlled substance, only take medications as prescribed, follow orders from social services. Court sets Status set for June 7th at 9:30 am.
